page.title: 19The Games Children Play
page.content: As in all playgrounds our children play singing, dancing, clapping, ball throwing and skipping games. The songs have been sung by generations of Prestonians with slightly changed words. Skipping games are played in spring. Ball games, always popular, have often kept the old words, e.g. One two three Alera I saw my sister Sara. Running games are popular e.g. Stick in the Mud and Scarecrow Tig. The boys favourite game is British Bulldogs, though it is very rough. The new game Elastics is very popular now. A circle of elastic is held around the legs of two or three children, whilst others jump over or astride it. The heights of the elastic vary. Rollerbooting, BMX riding and, for indoors, the computer, are popular occupations.
